intro: Thladiantha longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stalked thladiantha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when mature, which are edible but not widely cultivated. Thladiantha longipedicellata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
